alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Summers and central Monroe Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lick Creek, or near Pipestem, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alderson... Union... Red Sulphur Spring... Wolfcreek... Pickaway... Wayside... and Talcott. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
